variables.name: CidrIp
variables.required: Conditional. If you specify                      SourceSecurityGroupName, do not specify                      CidrIp.

variables.description: Start of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP type number.                   If you specify icmp for the IpProtocol property, you can                   specify -1 as a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP type number).
variables.name: FromPort
variables.required: Yes, for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.

variables.description: ID of the Amazon EC2 or VPC security group to modify. The group must belong to your                   account.
variables.name: GroupId
variables.required: Conditional. You must specify the GroupName                   property or the GroupId property. For security groups that                   are in a VPC, you must use the GroupId property. For example,                      EC2-VPC                   accounts must use the GroupId property.

variables.description: Name of the Amazon EC2 security group (non-VPC security group) to modify. This value                   can be a reference to an AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resource or the name of an existing Amazon EC2                   security group.
variables.name: GroupName
variables.required: Conditional. You must specify the GroupName                   property or the GroupId property. For security groups that                   are in a VPC, you must use the GroupId property. For example,                      EC2-VPC                   accounts must use the GroupId property.

variables.description: IP protocol name or number. For valid values, see the IpProtocol parameter                   in AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress
variables.name: IpProtocol

variables.description: Specifies the ID of the source security group or uses the Ref                   intrinsic function to refer to the logical ID of a security group defined in the                   same template.
variables.name: SourceSecurityGroupId
variables.required: Conditional. If you specify CidrIp, do not                   specify SourceSecurityGroupId.

variables.description: Specifies the name of the Amazon EC2 security group (non-VPC security group) to                   allow access or uses the Ref intrinsic function to refer to the                   logical name of a security group defined in the same template. For instances in a                   VPC, specify the SourceSecurityGroupId property.
variables.name: SourceSecurityGroupName
variables.required: Conditional. If you specify CidrIp, do not                   specify SourceSecurityGroupName.

variables.description: Specifies the AWS Account ID of the owner of the Amazon EC2 security group                   specified in the SourceSecurityGroupName property.
variables.name: SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId
variables.required: Conditional. If you specify                      SourceSecurityGroupName and that security group is owned                   by a different account than the account creating the stack, you must specify the                      SourceSecurityGroupOwnerId; otherwise, this property is                   optional.

variables.description: End of port range for the TCP and UDP protocols, or an ICMP code. If you                   specify icmp for the IpProtocol property, you can                   specify -1 as a wildcard (i.e., any ICMP code).
variables.name: ToPort
variables.required: Yes, for ICMP and any protocol that uses ports.
